author: cgood
post_text: August 25, 2021 at 7:11 PM#1Looking for the syntax to create a macro to change a specific effect that would change the low/high value to a specific color preset. Thank you.

posts.post_text: August 25, 2021 at 7:11 PM#1Looking for the syntax to create a macro to change a specific effect that would change the low/high value to a specific color preset. Thank you.

posts.author: Duplicate MarkvanderMeulen
posts.post_text: August 30, 2021 at 12:39 PM#2Hi Goodtech,As far as i know there is no way to assign a preset thru commandline to a effectvalue (high/low).If i understand you correctly you want to find a way to edit effects on the fly (busking style)What i do to edit effects on the fly is use two dedicated presets for high and low values in an effect and overwrite those presets thru macro's:[color=#33FF00]copy preset a.b at preset c.d/overwrite.[/color]That way you can edit your effcets to your needs

title: effect macro help please
